snippet: The senior justice official in the European Union was to announce a new effort Monday that could result in legislation requiring that women occupy up to 60 percent of the seats on corporate boards.
abstract: European Union senior justice official Viviane Reding is set to announce new effort that could result in legislation requiring that women occupy up to 60 percent of the seats on corporate boards.
lead_paragraph: The senior justice official in the European Union was to announce a new effort Monday that could result in legislation requiring that women occupy up to 60 percent of the seats on corporate boards.

headline.main: E.U. Considers Quotas for Women in Boardrooms
headline.print_headline: Europe to Study Quotas For Women on Boards
